name: Eaton, Hong Kong

reviews.text: I stayed in the Hotel from May 5 to May 8. room is very small only a bed. open sink and two cubicles for bath and toilet. you have to request for toiletries as the standard are only the soaps. i have called the hotel service for extra pillow but she cant understand me. i have to go down to the reception to ask for it( it was in the first night) until the last day i havent receive the additional pillows. didnt get a refill of the complimentary coffee and tea as we prep it at night while we rest.
reviews.title: Its OK...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: but overall like what others say the location is great. around 3 to 4 blocks away from the MTR and commercial/retail shops.
reviews.title: Great base to explore HK
Hong Kong.... What an Experience
reviews.text: A great balance of service, comfort and location for anyone visiting HK. Staff were very helpful at all times and made the stay easy. Our room was small but had all the amenity needed for a five day stay. Public transport options of bus or MTR made it easy to get around. Temple St night market nearby was good for food and cheap gifts after a long day out visiting the sites. Breakfast buffet was great way to start the day!
We stayed at the Eaton Hotel from 8th-14th March 2013.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first visit to Hong Kong and I can assure you it won't be the last!
reviews.title: would definitely stay again
Should be a 5 Star Hotel!
reviews.text: Brilliant hotel, we were on our way to new zealand and stayed at the eaton hong kong for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon, and they upgraded our room and gave us a lovely bottle of champagne! The room was a club executive room which was massive and so luxiorus! the staff are amazing and helpful and the club lounge was great with free internet access all day long and free drinks and champagne and breakfast. Its definetly worth having a club room as when we spoke to some brits who were staying in a basic room they were saying how horrible and pokey it was and that breakfast was so expensive to have as it wasent included in their package.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: fantastic!
reviews.title: We treasure our stay in the Eaton Hotel

likes.liked: — Close to shops, nice view, nice restaurants in the hotel

reviews.text: As a former manager of a hotel I can truly say that my stay in the Eaton Hotel is one of the best I have experienced lately. The staff is very effective and friendly. Especially the Eaton Club package is one of exclusive pampering.The Dim Sum restaurant in the basement is excellent and the Aroma Café serves the best Cafe Latte. Rooms are very comfortable with great beds.
reviews.title: the staff/personnel was very kind and very polite
An oasis from Nathan Road
reviews.text: The arrival at the Eaton hotel at Nathan Road was a good start. The very friendly people came directly towards us and helped us with the luggage. In the great and clean room there were fresh flowers. Special of the hotel was the so called E Club, during the whole day there were drinks and snacks available and in the morning a good breakfast buffet and in the evening tastefull hors d'oevres. Every day we had clean towels and blankets. Also the swimming pool and gym was very fine.
In the evening the singers in the cafe entertained us with their good voices.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, Recommend Higher Floors

reviews.text: Although I am now a teacher prior to this I spent twenty plus years in sales the last ten of which in corporate finance with the Bank of Scotland Group. During that time as I am sure you will understand I had occassion to stay on business in many hotels(including... Tower Bride, London...... The George...... Edinburgh, Gleneagles Hotel etc....etc.... I am pleased to tell you now that none of these previous experiences managed to measure up to the service I enjoyed at Eaton Hotel Hong Kong. This was really down to the check in at reception which left both my wife and myself feeling very positive about our decision not only to stay in Hong Kong but to stay at Eaton. The first impression could not have been better and as you know you cannot remake a first impression. I am pleased to report that the excellent job that Mykee had done was backed up by a similar level of performance by every other member of Eaton staff that we came into contact during our visit.................. We will return although the distance involved may mean that it will take longer than we would like.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Booked Eaton Hotel, last minute via Asiahotels
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff
Outstanding service
reviews.text: Service was excellent, in fact the reception staff were the best I have ever encountered!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a family of 2 adults and 3 children, and this usually causes some confusion regarding number of beds per room, configuration of rooms etc. particularly when booked via web sites with no facility to enter our specific requirements. Eaton staff were very helpful, providing extra bed and allocating almost adjacent rooms.
reviews.title: Nice hotel shame about the service
Great Hotel, Excellent Location
reviews.text: Initial rooms were a little "tired" and I requested renovated ones, these were organised later that day.

I stayed in a "Smart Room" at the Eaton, which had a non-conventional layout -- the bathroom consisted of two class "cabinets" (one for the toilet, one as the shower), each with their own door opening main room. The wash basin is on a bench between the bathroom and bed, and there's also a small chair to let you sit at the bench.
reviews.title: Great location, nice buffet breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself is Hong Kong style -- big enough for the bed and some walking space, but nothing extra. That's why they provide a hospital-style tray on wheels that fits over the bed (quite useful for using a laptop computer). Instead of carpet, the floor was similar to tatami mats and the window had wooden shutters rather than curtains. The room lighting was excellent and the cupboard includes a safe.
reviews.title: The Eaton sweetens with free internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a buffet breakfast in the Metro Restaurant, which is SO much better than the "Express Breakfast" that they normally offer in the cafe -- eggs cooked to order, an automatic pancake maker, dim sum and standard hot fare.
reviews.title: Good Location but Small Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had free wifi that worked well. My room was low down on Level 6, but was perfectly quiet. The bed was a good size (I'm rather tall).
reviews.title: Broom Closet

reviews.text: The Eaton is located in a great area, literally across the road from the popular Temple Street Night Market which is a must-see (as are the markets in Mong-Kok and Sham Shui Po). It's a short walk to the MTR stations and there are plenty of passing buses. I even took bus A21 from the airport (HK$33), which stopped practically outside the Eaton. (Buy yourself an Octopus card from the airport MTR station and use it throughout your trip -- even at restaurants and in taxis!)
reviews.title: Noisy Renovations 10am -6pm- not mentioned on their website!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Eaton Hotel for 7 nghts and had a great time. The room was clean although small but the hotel's location was excellent. We found the staff helpful and friendly and the rooftop pool was very inviting at night. The breakfast buffet contained plenty of variety and overall I would definately stay again if I was going back to Hong Kong.
reviews.title: great location and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my second time in H-K, and yes, the location is great...but next time will defenetely be closer to the Star Ferry/pier aera, wich I consider the best location in Kowloon...
reviews.title: Good value for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had reminded us of the Monterey in Kyoto, in terms of size...Enough for 1 person, but way too cramped for 2 with luggages....So make sure that you book a "big" room before going...
reviews.title: Great location, with roof terrace and modern room!

reviews.text: The hotel is quite well maintained and efficient, but had a claustrophobic feeling about it... dark and cramped...
reviews.title: Great customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good, but of course, quite pricey. As for dinner, the food is very good, but can be quite long to recieve somethimes...You can have dimsum at Nathan Hotel just on the other side of the street...There's a Starbuck just at the corner of Nathan Rd ( about 20 seconds walk).
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel, good location, room a bit small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Eaton Hotel for two nights from 16-18 January as part of our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Hong Kong
Eaton Hotel, Hong Kong
reviews.text: Booked the hotel based on the reviews mentioned below; and after my stay there I would concur with the positive reviews. In all, the Eaton is a comfortable and good value hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great and very helpful. All of them were very accomodating and showed us the sights and markets of Kowloon and Hong Kong. Mykee (?) in particular helped us initially get our bearings.
reviews.title: Good Place!

reviews.text: The rooms are small but at less than USD200 net, it presented great value for a good Hong Kong Hotel. It appeared that the room we had was recently renovated and felt well appointed.
reviews.title: Small

reviews.text: Will definitely stay there again on my next trip to Hong Kong!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Wash D.C Folks were Odd though

reviews.text: I was in Hong Kong for six weeks, staying on Hong Kong Island, so I wanted to stay at a hotel in Kowloon that was not "special occasion" like the Peninsula, but which would provide me with a certain level of comfort to get over my jetlag and get used to HK. After much research on TripAdvisor, the Eaton won over and I must say that I was not disappointed in the least.
reviews.title: great location, nice hotel
Reasonable Price, Great Service
reviews.text: There are a lot of comments posted about how small the room is. Yes, the room is small but most families in Hong Kong are living in two-bedroom apartments under 17 sq. m. Don't expect anything short of a very lavish waterfront suite to be any different. I loved how quick the hotel was to get to: at the airport, have the HK tourism desk write the hotel name and address in Cantonese, then take the airport link express to Kowloon, and a 10 minute taxi ride later gets you right to the front door. Without two or three pieces of luggage, it's five minutes from the MTR.

All the staff were very polite and helpful: the bell boy who helped me to my room almost refused to take my tip; the man at the business centre let me use the internet above and beyond the suggested 1 hour limit; a serviceman was sent immediately when I complained that the internet port in my room was not working; and the spa staff on the fitness floor were really wonderful.
reviews.title: Flawless
Wonderful & memorable stay
reviews.text: Great perks about the hotel: the gym opens at 6am (the pool at 8 or 10am) unlike some hotels, and there are lots of English television channels, great when you have 4am jet lag. Also, there is the Pacific Coffee Club (a Starbuck's type-coffee shop) right in the basement, with nice strong coffee and snacks if you are feeling culture shock, with free internet terminals.

reviews.title: Much nicer than the outgoing Hotel
reviews.text: I held my wedding banquet of 25 tables in the Diamond Ballroom in March, 2006. The reason why I choose Eaton Hotel is just because of the reasonable price and the beautiful ballroom, I really didn't expect too much...... this is the feeling of me before my banquet date.
Excellent location on Nathan road, close to shopping area and night market.
reviews.title: Excellent location, excellent service, very good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very convenient free shuttle bus from and to kowloon station (shuttle K1). It takes some time from the station to the hotel but it is very fast from hotel to the station.
reviews.title: Had everything we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Brilliant place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room are not big but well organized and have all amenities of a 4* hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bedding is very good.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and i must say we were extremely happy we chose this hotel!
reviews.title: This was a really great hotel!
Great location, great hotel
reviews.text: On arriving at the airport we went to get the shuttle bus (which we pre-booked) and were taken care of from then on! We were given a bottle of water, our tickets, a sticker identifying us (very organised!) then shown where to sit, collected and taken to the bus, which was quite lovely, very roomy and with leather seats!
Check in was easy, the room was just gorgeous! Some might say its small but thats by european standards, it has everything you could possibly need and the walk in shower was fab!
reviews.title: Great location
Eaton Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast was great too, eggs and stuff cooked to order, lots of fresh fruit, lots of types of breads, pastries, meats, even smoked salmon! Coffee was a bit slow in being delivered but hey, they were very busy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were also very helpful, including the English head chef! Very friendly!
reviews.title: Fine hotel in a central position

reviews.text: stayed here on my first visit to HK. Double room was very clean and big for asia standard. Cleaning staff was good. Location on Nathan Rd walk to all shops and restaurants. TST and harbour area all walking distance. MTR very closeby and bus stops. Laundry very expensive, take it to local laundry mat closeby or pay lots $$$. paid $80CDN per night 2 years ago, now after the renovations it's very expensive for stay. like double the rate.
reviews.title: great location for first hk visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have recently returned from a 4 night stay at the Eaton Hotel, Kowloon and can only report back positive things from my experience with this hotel which I have summarised below:
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Value for Money

reviews.text: ~ Easiest way to get to the hotel is by Airport Express MTR to Kowloon station and then on the complimentary shuttle bus K1 from the station, that take you right to the hotel. 1st bus is 06.12 and last bus is 23.12. These run frequently between the station and a loop of 6 hotels of which the Eaton is one. Cost for train and bus is $120 HK.
reviews.title: Broken room facilities, chaotic check-in & payment settlement

reviews.text: ~ Hotel is ideally placed in the middle of Nathan Road. A ten minute walk north takes you to Ladies Market and the Jade Market. A five minute walk south takes you to Temple Street Night markets. The hotel is also well within walking distance of the ferry terminal, waterfront and Avenue of the Stars.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Great Location
reviews.text: ~ The hotel itself has a concierge area on the bottom level, and reception is on floor 4, so the impression you get when you arrive is not the best. Once you are inside and at reception the impression does change markedly.

We travelled to Hong for the third time in 12 months and once more stayed at the Eaton as we had enjoyed our time here before. This time though the Eaton Club was up and running in full force, we received private check in and the girls are so helpful and lovely, then found we had been upgraded to a suite.
reviews.title: Cant beat the Eaton
Top Quality Hotel
reviews.text: Now on previous trips we had stayed in a superior room, smallish but we managed fine, a deluxe room, much larger but the suite...........2 rooms plus bathroom and gave us so much more space as we were travelling with our teenage daughter it was wonderful.
The Eaton is a wonderful hotel, the staff are so helpful, courteous and polite at all times and nothing is to hard for them.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only eat breakfast in the hotel as we have our favourite restaurant on Austin Road that we go to each night, but what we did eat was fresh and enjoyable, with no complaints at all.
reviews.title: Good service,excellent location

reviews.text: As people have mentioned you are close to everything from the Eaton but everything in Hong Kong is nearby. Taxis are a definite cheap way to travel especially if you are tired after a long day. Otherwise grab the octopus card and use the trains.
reviews.title: Good value central hotel
Central, smart but small rooms
reviews.text: We stayed at the Eaton, Hong Kong for 4 days in Nov 2006. The hotel is VERY central, and close to the Temple Street Night Market (3min walk) and on Nathan Road which has 100's of shops.
The closest undergrounr station is about a 7 min walk which was quite manageable.
reviews.title: Nice comfortable stay.

likes.disliked: — Room size was really really small.

reviews.text: The hotel is very smart but rather expensive and the rooms are very, very small...hardly room to move for 2 people with luggage etc.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just across the road from concierge area, is a small, great, cheap restaurant that is open till very late. There is also a MacDonalds across Nathan road for emergency food!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location
Can't fault it!
reviews.text: Hotel staff were friendly and amicable and accommodating.

Stayed at the Eaton in April for 5 nights. Loved this hotel. its in a fantastic location, walk to MTR Station, walk to markets, shops, everything! Very nice rooms, small of course but all Hong Kong hotels have small rooms I believe. Rooftop pool is lovely and the buffet breakfast (included) is to die for! Staff were very friendly and the hotel had a lovely atmosphere. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were very small and we needed two upgrades before we were happy. Ended up with and Eaton Club room Executive suite on the 16th floor. These are about $3000.00hk a night but, but if you are staying more than a couple of days, this would be more comfortable. The club room came with it's own 1st floor staff, free internet, and free drinks and food from 6.00pm to 8pm. American breakfast on the 4th floor was so, so. Ist floor staff were great and more familar with western requirements. You can book in and out through this reception. Location was central ,a choice between the two MTR subway staitions, still had you walking a couple of blocks either way. Temple street markets across the road, with general night market in one street then food the next. Everone was getting into the food if you new what to get. Again we decided to go it a lone regards tours. A long walk to the harbour stopping at most of the large department stores, then a Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island then a bus to the Stanley Markets and repulse bay was achievable but a full day. Another trip along the same lines to the Peak just about coverered what you could see in a short time. Overall ideal for the business man or a short stay.Money changer across the road from the main car prk entrance was consistant.
reviews.title: A Little Disappointed

likes.liked: — Club room was about the min size you would want for a weeks stay.
likes.disliked: — A left over smoking smell that was right through the hotel. Now non-smoking

reviews.text: I stayed at the Eaton frm 17 March for 6nights. Booked the executive room. Great for space not much of a view though. If you get the 180 degree window room, ur looking over part of Nathan Rd. If you get the slighty bigger room, u have no view at all. I stayed 1night at the slightly bigger one but then asked to move to the 180 degree window as i wanted some kind of view.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Great hotel
reviews.text: Very nice bed, comfy! Bathroom is nice as well, only one thing i didnt like about the bathroom is they have shower curtins and not glass ones.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The E club was very nice. Very cosy. Worth the money. Breakfast is nice varietly. Afternoon snacks with free alcohol is lovely but if your there for few nights, the afternoon snack becomes abit boring as they dont change much. Loved the all day coffee! All day internet access.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of September. We used the limo service from the airport and after a long flight from UK, this was the perfect way arrive and well worth the money. We were given a bottle of water each as soon as we approached the desk at the airport and were taken down to the car. The driver gave us a great commentary during the journey to the hotel and we were able to just chill and relax all the way. From start to finish, the staff were absolutely brilliant. All spoke English very well and Christine from Reception / eClub was especially helpful. We stayed in a club room and bought the eClub package. The eClub was like being in the first class lounge and was worth every penny. The hotel is modern and exceptionally clean. In an excellent location on Kowloon close to the shops and Temple Street market. If I ever get to Hong Kong again, I would choose this hotel without a second thought. We thoroughly enjoyed out stay here and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Just Fantastic

reviews.text: Gays, you are enthusiastic about this hotel, probably you forgot how hotel have to be.
reviews.title: so enthusiastic but WHY?

reviews.text: Totally small rooms – no space for your luggage, not so clean, much too expensive! This hotel have some business equipment and seems to be for business – but is NOT. Truly its very good hotel for persons who apply to be businessman and to whom it gives satisfaction to say – I slept in Eaton HK! – only.
reviews.title: Over-rated. Rooms are incredibly small!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And one more point – internet for 130HKD !!! – you can buy GSM pre-piad card with anlimited access for 38HKD daily!
reviews.title: nice, clean hotel with okay location

reviews.text: Our experience at Eaton Hotel was disappointing as we had chosen the hotel because the reviews were good.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: The Eaton was very near to all the markets and shops and easy access to Hong Kong Island.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — very close to the shops and markets

reviews.title: Great hotel, but traffic noise
reviews.text: The room was average, very small but clean. Reception is on the 4th floor, on the first evening we were on the 5th floor but unfortunately we could hear the music from the lounge on the 4th floor so we moved to a room higher up which was fine. I then had to get a room of my own because I was keeping my friend up all night snoring. I got myself an Eaton club room it was £80 a night including breakfast and use of the lounge. It was definately worth having an Eaton club room they were definately bigger.
I would recommend a stay at the Eaton Hotel.
reviews.title: Highly recommend Eaton Hotel

reviews.text: Lovely hotel, with friendly staff. Only problem was that we were on the 11th floor but were still kept awake by the noise of the traffic. Be careful we booked an executive room but were put into a club room, although we did question this at check in but to no avail. 20mins walk to Harbour, right in the heart of the shopping centre, short walk to night market.
reviews.title: Good hotel. Great value.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Eaton two nights end of January. Small but nicely furnished rooms, great shower/bath, beautiful swimming pool on roof. Nice exercise room, but did find elipitical machine not working. Other equipment all worked fine. Staff very accomadating, everybody polite and helpful. Within a couple of blocks of Temple street and Jade markets. Subway also within two blocks. E club worth extra price, I was picked up at the airport in a luxury bus, very nice happy hour and breakfast. Will stay here again if I return to Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Eaton was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best option for a tourist. First of all the location is brilliant. Everything is a walking distance, shopping mall, attractions, nightmarket, food etc.You can get the star ferry or the subway to get to the otherside. Make sure to check out the Hillwood street to the south where its packed with various restaurants.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Town

reviews.text: Room size is quite small but dont be surprised its quite usual in HK. Its very comfy clean and of course affordable.
reviews.title: Just beaware

reviews.text: 24/7 McD is across the road which is a plus for a late night munchies or after night out in the town.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money and terrific location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eaton Hotel Hong kong, is a brilliant hotel BUT we did ask for a room as high as posible for the views but this turned out to be a newly refurbished room which was quite small (as they always are in Hongkong) and the toilet and shower were in the actual bedroom as was the handbasin. There was a very small wardrobe which had 4 hangers in it and absolutely no drawer space at all. If this happens on our travels we usually utilise our suitcases BUT there was no room to put your suitcase on the floor without tripping over them at every move you made.
reviews.title: Very good value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel as a whole was great but wished we had known about the showering and toileting facilities.
reviews.title: Hong Kong Stay

description: Simply the best valued 4 star Hong Kong hotel, Eaton, Hong Kong offering comfort, convenience and connectivity for leisure and business travellers. Lobby featuring a new reception, Essentials retail shop, E Point (free use of computer with Internet access), indoor and outdoor bar areas including Metro Lounge, T Bar and T Garden. Conveniently located in the very heart of Hong Kong's business district and shopping areas, Eaton, Hong Kong is only a few minutes walk from the nearest MTR station (Jordan station)and many of the city's favourite tourist attractions including Temple Street and Jade Market. Look no further for some value added activities including complimentary Tai Chi Class and our exciting local tours of the Jade market and Temple Street market and audio guide to this city’s many fascinating tourist spots!The rooftop swimming pool is your perfect spot to relax and sip a cool drink whilst our Exert Fitness provides you with extensive cardio vascular training equipments. Wind down at our 7 restaurants and bar for a world of savoury treats and cuisines.
